intro: Chromolaena aridicola, commonly known as the desert false flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows in dry, rocky, or sandy soils. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. It has adapted to survive in harsh environments through deep root systems and reduced water loss. Chromolaena aridicola is often used in traditional medicine for its potential therapeutic properties.
